channel.title: CyberNetSec - Ransomware
channel.description: Latest ransomware threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Washington Post Breached by Clop Ransomware via Oracle Flaws
item.description:
The Washington Post has officially confirmed it was a victim of a large-scale cyberattack orchestrated by the Clop ransomware group. The threat actors exploited vulnerabilities in Oracle's E-Business Suite, compromising over 100 organizations globally. The campaign involves data exfiltration followe...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Synnovis Confirms Patient Data Stolen in Qilin Ransomware Attack on London Hospitals
item.description:
Pathology service provider Synnovis has officially confirmed that patient personal data, including names, NHS numbers, and dates of birth, was stolen during the June 2024 ransomware attack attributed to the Qilin gang. The attack caused widespread disruption to London hospitals, leading to the cance...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

item.title: Asahi Breweries Crippled by Ransomware Attack, Shipments Plummet to 10% Ahead of Peak Holiday Season
item.description:
Japan's largest brewer, Asahi Group Holdings Ltd., is facing severe operational paralysis more than a month after a devastating ransomware attack. The attack disabled the company's core order and shipment management system, forcing a regression to manual processes like phone calls and faxes. As a re...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Clop Ransomware Gang Claims Attack on Dartmouth College, Threatens to Leak Data
item.description:
The notorious Clop ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Dartmouth College, an Ivy League university in the U.S. On November 11, 2025, the group added the institution to its dark web leak site, threatening to publish exfiltrated data if the university does not enter ne...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Swedish IT Supplier Breach Exposes Personal Data of 1.5 Million Citizens
item.description:
The 'Datacarry' ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a major cyberattack on Miljödata, a Swedish IT supplier for local governments, exposing the sensitive personal data of up to 1.5 million people. The attack, which occurred in August 2025, targeted the company's HR systems, leading to th...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Akira Ransomware Hits US Manufacturer Koch & Co., Threatens to Leak 54GB of Data
item.description:
The Akira ransomware group has added U.S. manufacturer Koch & Co., Inc. to its list of victims. In a November 7 post on its dark web leak site, the group claimed to have stolen 54 gigabytes of sensitive corporate data, including detailed financials, contracts, and HR files. Akira is threatening to p...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Malicious VS Code Extension with Ransomware Capabilities Discovered on Official Marketplace
item.description:
A malicious Visual Studio (VS) Code extension named "susvsex" was discovered on the official VS Code Extension Marketplace. The extension, which appears to have been created with AI assistance, contained overt ransomware capabilities. Upon activation, it was designed to archive a target directory, e...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware

item.title: Software Supply Chain Attacks Skyrocket to Record High, Driven by Ransomware Gangs
item.description:
Software supply chain attacks reached an all-time high in October 2025, with 41 claimed incidents, according to a new report from Cyble. This figure is over 30% higher than the previous monthly record. Ransomware groups, particularly Qilin and Akira, are identified as the primary drivers of this tre...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Washington Post Confirms Breach in Cl0p's Oracle Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
The Washington Post confirmed on November 6, 2025, that it was a victim of the widespread supply chain attack orchestrated by the Cl0p ransomware gang. The attack exploited a zero-day vulnerability in Oracle's E-Business Suite (EBS), a widely used enterprise software platform. This confirmation came...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Conti's Ghost: New 'DragonForce' Ransomware Adopts Cartel Model
item.description:
A new ransomware operation named DragonForce has been identified by security researchers, notable for its use of leaked source code from the infamous Conti ransomware. Instead of a traditional Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) model, DragonForce operates with a 'cartel-like' structure, providing affili...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware
